title: Dorset and Hampshire Live: Thursday 16 February - BBC News
summary: sailor alex thomson sets sights on another vendee globe .
sus school incidents in southampton probed by police .
weather : dry , mild and becoming fairly sunny .

documents.title: aslef members reject southern deal
text: aslef members reject southern deal

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: the bbc local live service for dorset , hampshire and the isle of wight will resume on friday at 08:00 .
you can get still get in touch by email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .

documents.title: restoration plan for world 's fastest car
text: to celebrate the 90th anniversary of the sunbeam 1000hp breaking the 200mph land speed record , the national motor museum at beaulieu is planning make one of its engines run for the first time in over half a century .
the 1927 sunbeam 's two 22.5-litre v12 aero engines , which each produced 435bhp , have suffered from internal corrosion .
engineers at the museum plan to rebuild the rear-mounted engine .

the sunbeam 1000hp was once the fastest car in the world - in 1927 a crowd of 30,000 spectators watched maj henry segrave set a new world land speed record by driving the car at an average speed of 203.79mph at daytona beach in florida .

documents.title: county approves 4.99 % increase in council tax
text: hampshire county council has approved a 4.99 % increase in its council tax precept , which will mean a £ 1-a-week rise for the average band d household .
the authority said 3 % of the total increase was authorised by government to pay for social care .

documents.title: tourist office to close next month
text: dorchester 's tourist information office is to close at the end of march with the service moving to the town 's library .
the move is aimed at saving west dorset district council £ 80,000 a year .
more than 1,000 people signed a petition to keep the facility at antelope walk .
we are the move ! !
at the end of next month we will be re-locating to # dorchester @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: valentine tanks study launched
text: a project has been launched to explore and map seven world war two tanks that lie at the bottom of poole bay
the amphibious valentine tanks sank in 1944 during operation smash - a d-day rehearsal .
seven soldiers on board lost their lives.â

the isle of purbeck sub aqua club is leading the mapping of the wreckage over the next two years to create an exhibition and commemoration event in 2019 - marking the 75th anniversary of the sinking .
we want to collect the information and build a complete of the wrecks - the history of the operation and the wildlife that now inhabits the wrecks .
if anyone has information , get in touch with us .

documents.title: jose mourinho : manchester united manager worried about fixture congestion
text: manchester united boss jose mourinho has been voicing concerns about a build up of fixtures ahead of the epl cup final against southampton at wembley .
united have a fa cup tie and two europa league matches to play before their trip to wembley on 26 february , whereas the final is saints ' next competitive fixture .
we know our situation is really complicated .
the europa league is a competition where we play on thursdays and that makes it even more difficult for us .
with the accumulation of fa cup , league cup and matches postponed it is really hard for us .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: countdown to cat cafe opening
text: the final preparations are being made to a new `` cat cafe '' before it opens its doors .
called pause , the cafe on old christchurch road in bournemouth will offer customers the chance to grab a drink and something to eat - in the company of six rescue cats .
i realise the beneficial relationship between animals and humans .
i visited a cat cafe in milan and it was the most enjoyable experience i 've ever had and i just wanted to share that with people .

documents.title: virtual reality view of the new waterloo
text: network rail and south west trains have given commuters the chance to see a virtual reality view of the planned multimillion-pound re-development of the former international terminal at waterloo .
the new part of the station will be connected to the main station via a brand new bridge and concourse area , currently under construction .
the work forms part of the £ 800m investment to boost capacity at waterloo by 30 % by december 2018 .

documents.title: saints sell-out wembley
text: southampton fc have sold out their entire 32,000 seat allocation at wembley for their efl cup final match against manchester united on sunday 26 february .
there will also be two extra trains running on the day , it has been revealed today .
they will be leaving southampton central at 10:50 and 11:50 , stopping at southampton parkway , eastleigh , winchester and london waterloo .
they will return from waterloo , stopping at the same stations at 20:50 and 21:50 .
tickets for the # eflcup final have now sold out !
it 's time to start our # marchtowembley , # saintsfc fans

documents.title: suspect device 'not explosive '
text: the army 's explosive ordnance disposal experts have confirmed that the suspect object found in holyrood close , poole earlier was not an explosive device .
the police cordon in holyrood close has been removed and businesses are now reopening as normal .
any evacuated residents are being allowed back home .

documents.title: aslef driver expresses safety concerns
text: this aslef driver , who wanted to remain anonymous , told our reporter juliette parkin why he was against the deal with southern to end the strike .
author: Stuart Maisner
BBC Live reporter

documents.title: cyclist seriously hurt in poole collision
text: a cyclist has been seriously injured in a collision with a car in poole .
dorset police said the crash happened in blandford road shortly before 07:00 .
the cyclist - a local man in his 50s - sustained a serious head injury and was taken to hospital .
his injuries are not believed to be life-threatening .
the driver of the car - a local man in his 20s - was uninjured .

documents.title: sixteen cars damaged on isle of wight overnight
text: police are investigating damage caused to 16 cars in east cowes overnight .
the vehicles were damaged in adelaide grove , victoria grove and vectis road .
the damage included smashed wing mirrors , damaged windscreen wipers , a smashed windscreen and a dented car door .
a witness reported seeing two youths on the scene - one of the suspects was wearing grey jogging bottoms , they both had their hoods up , were wearing trainers and were carrying bottles .

documents.title: ofsted notes improvement at isle of wight school
text: the latest monitoring report was the second since the school was deemed to require improvement in march 2015 .
# isleofwight : carisbrooke college improves behaviour and results according to ofsted

documents.title: 'sus device ' found under car in poole
text: bomb disposal experts have been called after a `` sus device '' was found under a car in # poole

documents.title: vince hopes pre-season work will pay off
text: vince hopes pre-season work will pay off

documents.title: how aslef members voted over southern rail deal
text: members of the drivers ' union aslef rejected the deal agreed with southern rail by 54.1 % to 45.9 % .
the turnout was 72.7 % .
under the proposed agreement , southern would have been able to run trains without a guard or onboard supervisor under certain circumstances .
we understand and support the decision arrived at democratically by our members and will now work to deliver a resolution in line with their expectations .

documents.title: southern rail management 'hugely disappointed ' at aslef vote
text: we 've had reaction from southern 's parent company , govia thameslink railway , to the news that aslef members have rejected a deal with that would have ended the long-running industrial dispute .

naturally we 're saddened and hugely disappointed , as will be our passengers , with today 's decision by drivers , particularly as the agreement carried the full support and recommendation of the aslef leadership .
we now need to understand the issues which led to this outcome and we 'll be seeking to meet with the union as soon as possible to see how we can agree a way forward .

documents.title: aslef drivers reject union deal
text: aslef 's members on southern rail have voted against a deal to end the long-running series of strikes on the railway .

the members have therefore rejected the recommendation of their own union to support a deal negotiated over two weeks and that means there is still no end in sight to the disruption on one of the country 's busiest commuter networks .
author: Jonty Bloom
BBC Business correspondent

documents.title: breakingaslef workers reject southern deal
text: members of the aslef union have voted against a deal with southern that would have ended their long-running dispute .

documents.title: 'sus device ' under car
text: bomb disposal experts are examining a `` sus device '' found underneath a car in poole .
police were called to holyrood close shortly after 09:30 and a cordon was set up as a precaution .
homes and businesses have also been evacuated while the army 's explosive ordnance disposal team works to identify the device .

the army 's explosive ordnance disposal experts are on site .
please avoid the area .

documents.title: broadchurch returns for final series
text: fans of crime drama broadchurch are building up to its return to our screens at the end of this month .
the third and final series was shot in dorset and somerset throughout the summer of 2016 .
charlie higson joined the cast in the second series
so it looks like the new series of # broadchurch starts on the 27th .
but do n't bother with the 1st ep as i 'm not in it .

( the stuff about courgettes is a red herring # spoiler )

mine was a sadist , nickname `` bugs '' ?
mine once me up by my ankles and bounced my head on the floor .
but that was the 70s for you .
mine tried to me up by my whispy `` sideburns '' sadism on the curriculum at '60s teacher training colleges # '70'sgoldenyears

excellent .

documents.title: police appeal over stolen gates
text: police are appealing for information after these oak gates , worth £ 30,000 , were stolen from a house in liss .
the custom-made gates , on reeds lane , were thought to have been removed last thursday night .

documents.title: broken down lorry on m3 causing delays
text: # m3 # winchester - broken down hgv blcoking 1 lane on the j9 northbound offslip .
delays back to j10 .
# m3 # winchester - broken down hgv removed from the j9 northbound offslip .
delays easing .

documents.title: breakingdorchester prison homes plan granted
text: revised plans to convert a former prison into houses and flats have been approved .
developer city and country had submitted the new application to turn dorchester prison into 185 homes after a previous plan for 189 units was refused .
the firm said it had worked with residents , councillors and residents to address concerns over the impact on neighbouring properties and the character of the victorian buildings .

documents.title: posters provide insight into cinema history
text: a collection of film posters discovered in a portsmouth garden shed has been examined by the british film institute ( bfi ) .
they 're the work of laurence gleedle who painted colourful portraits of hollywood stars in the 1930s .
his son goff has taken them to london to be viewed by the bfi 's expert on vintage cinema posters .
these posters are a unique insight into one man 's contributions to the poster industry .
they take us behind the scenes of one of britain 's greatest printers and give us the biography of the artist which is so , so rare .
the names of these illustrators so often get lost - it 's lovely to see artwork we can attribute to one man .

documents.title: drilling work planned for collapsed road
text: drilling work planned for collapsed road

documents.title: third anniversary of portland storms
text: three year 's ago today , the dorset coast was being battered by some of the worst storms in recent years .
some of the most spectacular images came from portland where waves of up to 7.7m ( 25ft ) washed away sections of the sea wall at chesil cove .
large amounts of beach material was also lost - with the beach level reducing by 4m ( 13ft ) .

documents.title: woman charged following morning burglaries in portsmouth
text: a woman has been charged in connection with a series of morning burglaries in portsmouth .
the woman , of no fixed address , was charged with burglary , theft and attempted burglary following burglaries in sussex road and nightingale road on 31 jan .
she is due to appear before magistrates later .

documents.title: row over lidl car park exits
text: councillors call for changes at lidl as drivers continue to use the wrong exits when leaving the shop

documents.title: church of england 's rejection of gay marriage report welcomed
text: gay rights campaigners have welcomed the rejection by the church of england 's synod of a call for continued opposition to same-sex marriage .
the report by the house of bishops called for a `` culture of welcome and support '' for gay christians , but stopped short of accepting same-sex unions .
the debate , considered the focal point of this week 's synod , prompted impassioned speeches from members .
jay greene , from winchester , who is in a civil partnership , said congregation members want the church to go `` further , faster , forward '' .
she told the synod many were `` deeply disappointed '' by the report and its `` tone of fear '' .

documents.title: council discussion over dorchester prison site
text: the future of the former dorchester prison is being discussed later .
west dorset district council 's meeting will consider a second planning application to build 185 houses and apartments on the site .
the council refused to give planning permission for housing at the site last august - following concerns by councillors over the impact of the development on nearby residents .
a revised application with four fewer homes has been submitted by the developer city and country .

documents.title: alex thomson sets sights on another vendee globe
text: gosport sailor alex thomson has been reflecting on his experience after finishing second in the vendee globe round-the-world yacht race .
thomson , 42 , completed the race last month after 74 days , 19 hours and 35 minutes at sea .
he matched dame ellen macarthur as the highest-placed british competitor - she finished second in the 2001 race .
he told bbc south today 's sally taylor and kris temple that he was already looking ahead to another go at the challenge .

documents.title: sus school incidents probed by police
text: police in southampton are investigating two sus incidents involving children walking to and from school .
on monday , two girls walking home from cantell school became concerned after seeing a sus looking man on a bike .
one of the girls , who 's 11 , was then later approached by who she thought was the same man in a blue car on copperfield road .
while on wednesday morning , a 10-year-old girl was approached by a man in a small blue van on laburnham road on her way to bassett green school .

documents.title: football gossip : wilshere considered by city
text: manchester city boss pep guardiola will consider a move for 25-year-old arsenal midfielder jack wilshere , who is currently on loan at bournemouth , according to former barcelona star xavi .
( fox latin america , via daily mirror ) .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: delays following crash on a3 near petersfield
text: vehicle hits central reservation and flips on hampshire dual carriageway

documents.title: aslef set to announce southern rail deal vote
text: the outcome of a vote by southern rail train drivers on a new working contract is due to be revealed later .
members of the aslef union have been voting on a deal reached with management on 2 february , aimed at solving the long running dispute over driver only operated trains .
the deal includes details of circumstances when a train can be operated as driver-only , without an on-board supervisor .
the rmt union - which yesterday announced it will be striking next wednesday - has described the agreement as a `` betrayal '' .

text: headlines for hampshire and the isle of wight

documents.title: weather : dry , mild and becoming fairly sunny
text: a fine morning , with any early low cloud , mist or localised fog patches gradually clearing to give some sunny spells .
a mild day then follows , although some cloud could spread in from the northwest during the evening .
highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to our local live service for dorset , hampshire and the isle of wight on thursday .
we 'll be bringing you the latest headlines from across the three counties .
you can get in touch too , by email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .
